title.value: Баланс энергии у лактирующих коров при разных сочетаниях накопления и мобилизации жира и белка в организме
The energy balance in lactating cows at different combinations of accumulation and mobilization of fat and protein in the body
The energy balance in lactating cows at different combinations of accumulation and mobilization of fat and protein in the body

journal.title: Zootechnical Science of Belarus: collection of scientific papers

person.name: Lemeshevskij, V.O., Polesje State Univ., Pinsk (Belarus)

abstract.value: According to the authors opinion a significant lack of energy (in this case 27,6 +- 4,3 MJ / day) plays a crucial role in the mobilization of fat and protein in lactating cows. With moderate energy deficit (in this case 9,9 +- 2,2 MJ / day) due to the mobilization of fat accumulation of protein in the body may take place. At simultaneous mobilization of fat and protein mobilization of fat in cows body was equaled on the average-628 g/day, and protein mobilization was equaled-188 g/day, or it is less on 70,1%. At simultaneous adjournment of fat and protein the size of fat adjournment was on the average equaled 359, and protein accumulation - 201 g/day, or it is less on 44,0%. Thus, both at mobilization and at deposition the fat weight changes on the average on the big size. Authentic correlation (P 0,01) between balances of fat and protein weights is noted only at their integrated mobilization. Highly authentic positive correlation at lacted cows had negative balances of fat and protein weights, the sum (total energy of fat balance + exchange energy of protein balance) with exchange energy of protein testifies to sharp deficiency of energy. Positive correlation of the same pair of parameters was authentic also at a combination of adjournment of fat and fat and protein. The opinion as a result proves to be true, that defining role in an identical orientation of fat and protein balances from all physiological factors is played energy providing
